Articles.Content: Don't forget to add a license for your work while you're at it!

Don't forget to add a license for your work while you're at it!

A little un-educated on this front, could you point me in the right direction.

Yeah sure. Ill edit this post when I've got the info for you.

Edit: You don't need a totally "serious-business" one. Just a line or so in the OP explaining what you'll allow people to do with your parts in terms of redistribution of your files and config edits and whatnot. --> Info from DYJ.

Edited May 31, 2013 by shadowsutekh

Yeah sure. Ill edit this post when I've got the info for you.

Thanks, as you posted I got info regarding Creative Commons Licencing. I've added it to my original post.
Alrighty then. Happy to bring that to your attention, ect. Thanks for the info on your parts compatibility as well. Much appreciated.

This is totally OCD talking, but can you either remove the ladders on the tunnel or make them go along the whole thing? I keep having to put 2 of the small ladders between them and it is hurting my part count (my computer isn't the best). Also, would it be possible to make the windows light up like the B9 windows or is that too much work? Just a request.

Otherwise, these are fantastic

This is totally OCD talking, but can you either remove the ladders on the tunnel or make them go along the whole thing? I keep having to put 2 of the small ladders between them and it is hurting my part count (my computer isn't the best). Also, would it be possible to make the windows light up like the B9 windows or is that too much work? Just a request.

Otherwise, these are fantastic

Hey, I will give that part a full ladder at some point over the weekend.

As for the window lighting, I can give that a go too.

Update:

- The Large Structural Corridor and Large Observation Window now have window lighting. These parts will not light other parts, however they will look like a light is on inside.

Warning: These parts now have power consumption, they draw at the rates of -0.125 and -0.25. Make sure your craft have ample power.

Download has been updated, found in the original post.

You are awesome

THANKS!!!

You are awesome

THANKS!!!

Not a problem.

Next task, refining the ladders on the Large Structural Corridor.

Thank you for making these. I had to double-check the time-frame of this thread, impressively fast work considering the quality here.

A request: now that some of your parts are using electricity, it would be great to have a battery in the same style. Maybe it could attach unobtrusively on the outside. The look of the batteries available in Kerbal has always been something to work around when ship-building, imho.
Oh that large hub looks like a perfect compliment to the stock hub. I will be using this for sure

Thank you for making these. I had to double-check the time-frame of this thread, impressively fast work considering the quality here.

A request: now that some of your parts are using electricity, it would be great to have a battery in the same style. Maybe it could attach unobtrusively on the outside. The look of the batteries available in Kerbal has always been something to work around when ship-building, imho.

There is a mod that makes 2.5m batteries... I think it is the Kerbal X parts or something like that... Its the one that originally had the capola and skipper engine that was incorporated into stock.

that would be the KSPX parts pack, IIRC it is now being maintained by KasperVid and he updated it to be compatible with the 0.20.X "GameData" system. The version on KerbalSpacePort is compatible with KSP 0.18.x-0.19.x and still uses the old "KSP_win/Parts" system.

I was wondering if the quantum struts mod you have works in .20?

I can't seem to find it anywhere. if you can tell me where it is I would be so grateful, oh and I love the 6 way connector piece you made, because now its one part for the 2.5 m pieces, instead of the smaller one with all the adapters!

I was wondering if the quantum struts mod you have works in .20?

I can't seem to find it anywhere. if you can tell me where it is I would be so grateful, oh and I love the 6 way connector piece you made, because now its one part for the 2.5 m pieces, instead of the smaller one with all the adapters!

Yep the Quantum Struts have been updated for .20. Here's the link to the SpacePort for it: http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/quantum-strut/

Thank you for making these. I had to double-check the time-frame of this thread, impressively fast work considering the quality here.

A request: now that some of your parts are using electricity, it would be great to have a battery in the same style. Maybe it could attach unobtrusively on the outside. The look of the batteries available in Kerbal has always been something to work around when ship-building, imho.

This is nice idea. I'll create a radial and in line battery today as well as a large generator.

This is nice idea. I'll create a radial and in line battery today as well as a large generator.

In my constant attempts to get the part count of my stations down, the one thing I'm always looking for is a 2.5m inline battery+backup generator unit, equivalent to at least 4 stock RTGs and a 2.5m KSPX battery of 1000 units. One would be enough for a station, longer stacks would work for building electric vehicles or kethane refineries.

I'm never finding anything quite like that for some reason.

One would be enough for a station, longer stacks would work for building electric vehicles or kethane refineries.

I'm never finding anything quite like that for some reason.

You won't have long to wait then =D

In my constant attempts to get the part count of my stations down, the one thing I'm always looking for is a 2.5m inline battery+backup generator unit, equivalent to at least 4 stock RTGs and a 2.5m KSPX battery of 1000 units. One would be enough for a station, longer stacks would work for building electric vehicles or kethane refineries.

I second that Some of my more outrageous designs of interplanetary ships suffer from this problem too. And they do look like startled hedgehogs, with solar panels sticking in all directions. Such part would be a huge improvement.

Update

- Large Inline Battery is now available for use within the parts pack (Capacity of 2000 ElectricCharge).

- Large Inline Generator is now available for use within the parts pack (Generates ElectricCharge at 5.0/s).

All downloads available from Original Post.

Edited June 2, 2013 by udk_lethal_d0se

It's kinda creepy how fast you can dish out parts. None-the-less, excellent work! I've gotten a ton of use out of the tabs for the struts.

Any chances you have a planet colonization pack in the works? Would love to see the designs you come up with!

It's kinda creepy how fast you can dish out parts. None-the-less, excellent work! I've gotten a ton of use out of the tabs for the struts.

Any chances you have a planet colonization pack in the works? Would love to see the designs you come up with!

I actually have plugin plans for Orbital Factories and Micro-management, such as distributing power to different connected services... which is where these parts will come in handy.

Edited June 2, 2013 by udk_lethal_d0se

[update]

- Large Structural Corridor now has a full ladder.

Download in Original Post updated.
Ooh, thank you!
